description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to: (a) improve passenger ferry infrastructure and service in Assam, and (b) improve the institutional capacity and framework for inland water transport in Assam

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
Transport Dept., Govt. of Assam, Dispur, Guwahati (Assam), India

condition.narrative: Section I.A.3(a) of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to retain throughout Project implementation the services of ageneral consultant with qualification and experience and under TORs acceptable to the Bank, in order to assist AIWTDS and DIWTA byproviding managerial support for the carrying out of Project activities.

Section I.A.3(b) of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to hire, within 6 months of effectiveness, and maintainthroughout Project implementation, the services of: (a) a technical service and supervision consulting firm to assist AIWTDS andDIWTA's divisional offices in monitoring and executing Component 3 of the Project; (b) an independent consulting firm to assistAIWTDS and DIWTA with the preparation and implementation of the relevant safeguard documents; and (c) a chartered accounting firmto carry out AIWTDS semi-annual internal audits; all these consultants with qualifications and experience and under TORs agreedwith the Bank.

Section I.A.3(c) of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to retain throughout Project implementation the services of achartered accounting firm with qualifications and experience and under TORs agreed with the Bank to carry out the annual audits ofthe Project financial statements.
Section I.B of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to implement the Project in accordance with the Operations Manual.

Section I.C of the Schedule to the Project Agreement: AIWTDS to prepare and furnish to the Bank on annual basis, and by no laterthan March 31 of each year, commencing in March 31, 2021, the annual work plan and budget for the Project covering the activitiesproposed for the subsequent fiscal year of Project implementation. However, the annual work plan and budget for the first year ofimplementation to be prepared by July 31, 2020.

Section I.E of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to (i) publicly invite private ferry operators to submit proposalsfor the upgrading / retrofitting of existing vessels / fleet or the acquisition of new ones, all in accordance with the OperationsManual and (ii) upon selection of a private ferry operator as beneficiary of the “Jibondinga” incentive scheme (i.e. beneficiary ofthe Matching Grant), enter into a Matching Grant Agreement with such awardee / beneficiary under terms and conditions set forth inthe Operations Manual and acceptable to the Bank.

Sections I.A.1 and I.A.2(c) of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:GoA to carry out the Project through its TransportDepartment, handling all fiduciary and implementation matters through AIWTDS as per the Operations Manual. To this end, AIWTDSshall be headed by the government officer not below the rank of Secretary to the Transport Department, and comprised of qualifiedand experienced staff in adequate numbers under TORs satisfactory to the Bank.

Sections I.A.2(a) & (b) of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:Assam to maintain throughout Project implementation: (a) aProject Guidance Council headed by the Chief Secretary of Assam for providing policy guidance for, and general oversight of,Project activities; and (b) a Governing Body, headed by the senior most Secretary of the Transport Department, for managing,coordinating and monitoring Project implementation, including exercising all executive and financial powers of AIWTDS.

Sections I.D of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:For purposes of DLI(s)/DLR(s) #2, #5.3, #6.1; #6.2; and #7, AIWTDS toselect and hire within 6 months of effectiveness, and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, the services of amonitoring and evaluation consulting firm (IVA) with qualifications and experience and under TORs agreed with the Bank, toundertake quarterly verification processes of the progress made on the achievement/fulfillment of those DLIs(s)/DLR(s). AIWTDS toshare with the Bank each verification report within 30 days of completion by the IVA.

Sections I.F.1 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTD to: (a) carry out the Project in accordance with the EMF, the SMF,and the RPF-cum-IPDF, as well as the EMP(s), SMP(s), RAP(s), and IPDP(s) to be prepared pursuant the former (the safeguarddocuments); and (b) not to amend the safeguard documents without the concurrence of the Bank.

Sections I.F.2 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:Prior to inviting any bids from contractors/providers or awarding anyMatching Grant to beneficiaries, AIWTDS to: (a) screen the Project activities as per the EMF, SMF and RPF-cum-IPDF; (b) prepare asapplicable the EMP(s), SMP(s), RAP(s) of IPDP(s) required for such activities under the EMF, SMF and/or RPF-cum-IPDF, and (c)publicly disclose all safeguard documents in local language(s) at the relevant Project's sites, at least 30 days prior to invitingany bids or awarding a Matching Grant.

Sections I.F.3 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to ensure that prior to commencing any civil works or theoperation of any new vessel: (a) all necessary governmental permits and clearances have been obtained; (b) allpre-construction/pre-operation conditions imposed by the governmental authorities have been complied with/fulfilled; and (c) in thecase of civil works, any resettlement or social protection measures required in relation to such civil works have been fullyexecuted (including full payment of compensation prior to displacement and/or the provision of relocation assistance).

Sections I.F.4 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to ensure that each contract for civil works includes theobligation of the relevant contractor to comply with the relevant safeguard documents including the preparation of a labor-influxrisk mitigation plan and a GBV action plan. Each such contract shall mandate that the contract request all works to sign a code ofconduct adhering to such labor-influx risk management plan and GBV action plan as pre-condition for employment in such civil works.Contractors shall also maintain internal complaint committees.

Sections I.F.5 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to draft within 3 months of effectiveness, standard operatingprocedures, setting forth the safety and security measures for passengers, and their implementation protocols, in relation togender-based violence in IWT, and DIWTA, ASC, APC and all private ferry or terminal operators receiving, or benefiting from, theProject's financial support shall adhere to and comply with these GBV-SOP as a precondition for such support, and establishinternal complaint committees.

Sections I.F.6 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to: (a) maintain monitoring and evaluation protocols and recordkeeping procedures acceptable to the Bank and adequate to supervise and assess the implementation of / compliance with thesafeguard documents; and (b) select and hire within 6 months of effectiveness a safeguard monitoring consultant with qualificationsand experience and TORs acceptable to the Bank, to prepare semi-annual safeguards monitoring reports.

Sections I.F.7 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to strengthen within 3 months of effectiveness the currentmulti-tier, project-specific grievance processing and redress mechanism for handling stakeholder complaints arising out of theProject.

Sections II.2 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement:AIWTDS to prepare and furnish by no late than December 31, 2022 a mid-termreview report in a manner and substance satisfactory to the bank, and by February 15, 2023, review such report with the Bank, andtake all measures required to ensure efficient completion of the Project and achievement of the Project's objectives.
